description: Empirical statistical downscaling involves using statistical methods to derive local climate information from larger-scale climate models. This technique is particularly useful in regions where direct climate observations are sparse or missing.
you_have_this_if: You are dealing with missing climate data.
You are working in areas with limited observational data.
You want to extend short-term forecasts with historical data.

approaches.technique: RASCAL (Reconstruction by AnalogS of ClimatologicAL time series)
approaches.best_for: when you need to reconstruct missing climate data in regions with limited observations.
approaches.key_tradeoff: While RASCAL is effective for reconstruction, it may not perform well in areas with abundant observational data.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need to fill gaps in climate data for specific regions with limited observations.

start_here: Start with RASCAL for reconstructing missing climate data, as it is specifically designed for this purpose and has been validated in relevant studies.
